message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Collagen synthesis is dependent on Vitamin C, which can be inactivated by overheating. Therefore, if the mother boiled the formula longer than needed, it could impair the infant's collagen synthesis. Heme synthesis is dependent on iron and has no relation to formula feeding. Protein catabolism and fatty acid metabolism are also not related to the issue at hand.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Overheating the formula can lead to the inactivation of Vitamin C, which is needed for collagen synthesis. Heme synthesis is not affected by Vitamin C deficiency, and protein catabolism and fatty acid metabolism are not related to Vitamin C function.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine and biochemistry for help. Collagen synthesis is dependent on Vitamin C, and overheating formula can result in the inactivation of Vitamin C, therefore impairing collagen synthesis. Heme synthesis, protein catabolism, and fatty acid metabolism are not dependent on Vitamin C.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Overheating the formula can cause inactivation of Vitamin C, which is involved in collagen synthesis. Heme synthesis involves iron, protein catabolism involves breakdown of proteins, and fatty acid metabolism involves the breakdown of fats.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Vitamin C is essential for collagen synthesis, so if the formula is boiled longer than needed, it can lead to impaired collagen synthesis in the child's body. Heme synthesis is not related to Vitamin C, and protein catabolism and fatty acid metabolism do not involve Vitamin C.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Vitamin C is important in collagen synthesis, so if the formula is boiled longer than needed and the Vitamin C is inactivated, collagen synthesis may be impaired. Heme synthesis is not related to Vitamin C, and protein catabolism and fatty acid metabolism are not affected by Vitamin C.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Collagen synthesis is dependent on Vitamin C, which can be inactivated by overheating. Heme synthesis requires iron and protein catabolism involves breaking down proteins into amino acids. Fatty acid metabolism involves the breakdown and conversion of fats into energy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Collagen synthesis is dependent on Vitamin C, which can be inactivated by overheating. The other options are unrelated to Vitamin C or formula feeding.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Collagen synthesis requires vitamin C, which may be inactivated by overheating. The other options are not related to vitamin C or formula feeding.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Vitamin C is necessary for collagen synthesis, so if the formula is overheated, collagen synthesis could be impaired. Heme synthesis relies on iron, protein catabolism is the breakdown of protein into amino acids, and fatty acid metabolism is the breakdown of fat into energy, none of which are directly affected by overheating formula.
